conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls are extruded with thickness, top edges and side faces are visible, interior spaces read as volumes, and the camera is in an angled/isometric-like view with the ceiling/roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion and readable room volumes; clean cutaway presentation with mostly consistent corner geometry and limited distortion.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout (outer rectangle, kitchen at left, stairs bottom-left, small central bathroom, large open living/dining at right) broadly matches, but several openings (windows/doors) do not align with the 2D plan and some wall/opening placements appear altered (e.g., added/shifted window set on the top wall and differing exterior window distribution).

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen counters/cooktop shown; dining table/chairs included; bathroom fixtures indicated. Living-room furniture (e.g., sofa) is largely absent/simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry and openings are readable with good lighting; however, large text labels on walls/floors reduce presentation cleanliness and some edge/trim elements add visual noise.

detected_errors.description: Door/window locations and counts do not consistently match the 2D plan (notable discrepancies on exterior walls).
Some geometric fidelity issues: certain openings/partitions appear shifted or introduced compared to the plan, reducing strict layout accuracy.
Prominent text labels inside the 3D render reduce clean presentation (not pure UI overlay, but contaminates clarity/aesthetic scoring).

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway with strong volumetric modeling, but with noticeable door/window and some partition/opening mismatches versus the 2D floor plan.
